title: Two-Proportion Test: Power
question_text:
Which of the following statements is/are NOT true about power in the context of a two-proportion test?
I. Large sample sizes will often allow the statistician to find a significant difference between the two proportions if one really exists.
II. Low alpha levels will allow the statistician to find a significant difference between the two proportions if one really exists.
III. Power will be $1$, the probability of a Type I error.
